page.title: 01FARMING
page.content: Hall Farm and Croft Farm were both much larger in the past. Hall Farm has sold about 700 of its original 1200 acres, mainly in the last two generations.An enormous decrepit barn was being pulled down to make way for housing. Both farms only employ one worker each and have been owned by the same family for several generations. Both farms grow wheat and barley as their main crops, with peas also important. In addition Croft Farm (165 acres) grows much mustard;Hall Farm, sugarbeet and interestingly ticbeans specially grown for pigeon-feed.An average field is 15-20 acres. A typical farmer's day starts at 8a.m. and goes on till 8.30 p.m. but he has Dec-Feb off. It takes a month for the harvest. Spring barley is the least reliable crop.
